result.execSummary:
The defendant Daron L May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 65 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be refunded balance to poster.
DNA Surcharge waived.

No Contact with any co-defendants.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school  No use of possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Huber privileges are revoked for the balance of the sentence.   Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on July 20, 2016.
Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting to be returned to Huber
Received July 18, 2016 from Jail Administrator Michael Giese, requesting Mr. May's Huber privileges be revoked

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daron L May in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State withdraws motion to amend information.  Court orally amends Information.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 1 year Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 65 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  No contact with any codefendants.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.   Defendant Daron L May did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was taken into custody last week and was released this afternoon.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daron L May in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's motion for bail modification.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court orders cash bail modified to $2,500.00.  All bond conditions to remain as previously set.  Defense is awaiting discovery.  Defense requests the 11/6 hearing date be pushed out to allow time to receive and review discovery.  Hearing on 11/6/14 adjourned.  Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Daron L May in court, in custody, with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bowe advised court that she has been retained by defendant. Court advised parties that Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse was here for today's hearing and the Court excused Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse's appearance.   Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. State requests 30 days to file Information. State placed on the record of a possible conflict with Attorney Bowe representing the defendant. Court hears defense bail motion. State objects to bail modification and presents their argument to the court. Attorney Bowe presents her argument to the court. Court denies motion to modify bail.  Bail can be renewed before the trial court judge.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
